prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a simple, geometric shape with a flat base and a triangular top. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0023]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1). 4. Face\\_1 should contain one loop (loop\\_1). 5. Loop\\_1 should consist of four lines: * Line\\_1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0]. * Line\\_2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.158]. * Line\\_3: Starting at [0.75, 0.158] and ending at [0.0, 0.158]. * Line\\_4: Starting at [0.0, 0.158] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 6. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 7. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 8. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create a height of 0.0012, and along the opposite normal vector with the same value. Part 2: Construct a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0483, 0.0023]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1). 4. Face\\_1 should contain one loop (loop\\_1). 5. Loop\\_1 should consist of four lines: * Line\\_1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0]. * Line\\_2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0613]. * Line\\_3: Starting at [0.75, 0.0613] and ending at [0.0, 0.0613]. * Line\\_4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0613] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 6. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 7. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 8. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create a height of 0.0012, and along the opposite normal vector with the same value. Please note that the instructions provided are based on the given JSON, without making any additional assumptions. The final shape of the assembly would be approximately three times the width and two times the height of the individual components.</description>

Part 2: A CAD model of three cylinders Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2, with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0112, 0.1342, 0.0023]. Finally, extrude the 3D sketches with a depth of 0.1342 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal, resulting in a CAD model of three cylinders, each with slightly different heights and widths, arranged in a diagonal line from the top left to the bottom right of the image.
